title: Article 5 : Laboratory-evolved bacteria switch to consuming carbon dioxide for growth
description: Researchers have discovered a strain of E. coli that can use CO2 as energy for metabolism. This discovery paves the way for carbon-neutral industrial production.

title: Article 4 : Scientists Program CRISPR to Fight Viruses in Human Cells
description: Crisper-Cas13 is a promising method to fight against viruses such as Ebola or influenza.

title: Article 3 : Gene Editing Humans: It's Not Just about Safety
description: In november 2018, He Jiankui, a chinese scientist shocked the world editing two embryos and letting them grow. A community of scientists got together to fix guidelines for human germ line editing that scientists have to follow.

title: Article 2 : What your DNA Can't tell you
description: Since it is possible to obtain the sequence of our genome from laboratories, scientists warn consumers to misinterpret the analyzes. For example, is intelligence inscribed in our genes?

title: Article 1 : CRISPR enters its first human trials
description: The CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing technique was discovered by a French researcher Emmanuelle Charpentier collaborating with an American Jennifer Doudna. This tools  allow modifying genome sequences with precision and open the way of new discoveries. Reseachers are working on different applications such as prevent or cure diseases.
